channel.title: CyberNetSec - Supply Chain Attack
channel.description: Latest supply chain attack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Retailers Unprepared for AI-Powered Cyberattack Tsunami, Report Warns
item.description:
A new report from managed security provider LevelBlue reveals a troubling state of cybersecurity in the retail sector. The study found that 44% of retailers have experienced a significant increase in cyberattacks, with many feeling unprepared for the next wave of AI-powered threats. Despite 45% of e...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Phishing, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: UK Introduces Sweeping Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Regulate MSPs and Mandate Stricter Breach Reporting
item.description:
The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill to Parliament, a landmark piece of legislation set to replace the 2018 NIS Regulations. This new bill significantly expands the regulatory landscape by bringing Managed Service Providers (MSPs) into scope for the first time, a m...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Asahi Breweries Crippled by Ransomware Attack, Shipments Plummet to 10% Ahead of Peak Holiday Season
item.description:
Japan's largest brewer, Asahi Group Holdings Ltd., is facing severe operational paralysis more than a month after a devastating ransomware attack. The attack disabled the company's core order and shipment management system, forcing a regression to manual processes like phone calls and faxes. As a re...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Swedish IT Supplier Breach Exposes Personal Data of 1.5 Million Citizens
item.description:
The 'Datacarry' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a major cyberattack on Miljödata, a Swedish IT supplier for local governments, exposing the sensitive personal data of up to 1.5 million people. The attack, which occurred in August 2025, targeted the company's HR systems, leading to th...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: OWASP Top 10 for 2025 Released, Spotlighting Supply Chain and Design Flaws
item.description:
The OWASP Foundation has released the 2025 release candidate for its influential Top 10 list of web application security risks. This update signals a major shift in focus, with the introduction of new categories like 'A03: Software Supply Chain Failures' and 'A10: Mishandling of Exceptional Conditio...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Chinese-Made Electric Buses in Europe & Australia Pose Remote Shutdown Risk
item.description:
Cybersecurity tests conducted in Norway on November 7, 2025, have uncovered a significant security risk in Chinese-manufactured Yutong electric buses, which are widely used across Europe and Australia. The 'Lion Cage' experiment demonstrated that the buses' connected systems could theoretically be a...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Malicious VS Code Extension with Ransomware Capabilities Discovered on Official Marketplace
item.description:
A malicious Visual Studio (VS) Code extension named "susvsex" was discovered on the official VS Code Extension Marketplace. The extension, which appears to have been created with AI assistance, contained overt ransomware capabilities. Upon activation, it was designed to archive a target directory, e...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware

item.title: Patient Sabotage: Malicious NuGet Packages with Time-Delayed ICS Payloads Discovered
item.description:
Security researchers have discovered nine malicious packages on the NuGet repository, downloaded over 9,400 times, containing hidden, time-delayed sabotage code. One package, 'Sharp7Extend,' was specifically designed to corrupt write operations in industrial control systems (ICS) by silently causing...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Industrial Control Systems, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Software Supply Chain Attacks Skyrocket to Record High, Driven by Ransomware Gangs
item.description:
Software supply chain attacks reached an all-time high in October 2025, with 41 claimed incidents, according to a new report from Cyble. This figure is over 30% higher than the previous monthly record. Ransomware groups, particularly Qilin and Akira, are identified as the primary drivers of this tre...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Confirms Breach in Cl0p's Oracle Supply Chain Attack
item.description:
The Washington Post confirmed on November 6, 2025, that it was a victim of the widespread supply chain attack orchestrated by the Cl0p ransomware gang. The attack exploited a zero-day vulnerability in Oracle's E-Business Suite (EBS), a widely used enterprise software platform. This confirmation came...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Ransomware, Data Breach

Read Full Article →
